reuters.title: MATSUSHITA IN JOINT VENTURE WITH FORD, MAZDA
reuters.body: Matsushita Electric Industrial Co Ltd <MC.T>, Mazda Motor Corp <MAZT.T> and Ford Motor Co <F> have signed an agreement to set up a joint venture to make car air conditioners in Japan, Matsushita said in a statement. The new venture, <Japan Climate Systems Corp> will be capitalised at 1.5 billion yen, and the three partners will hold equal shares. The partners will invest 3.6 billion yen in constructing a plant in Hiroshima, due for completion in late 1988. The plant will initially make 100,000 air conditioners a year for Mazda, it said.
